words.description:
to fall back on one's reserves 依靠自己的儲備
oil/capital reserves 石油／資金儲備
words.example:
vt.及物動詞
1.儲備，保存；保留[（+for）]
These seats are reserved for special guests. 這些座位是為特別來賓保留的。
We will reserve the money; we may need it later. 我們將把這筆錢存起來，也許以後用得著。
2.預約，預訂
They have reserved rooms at a hotel. 他們已預訂了旅館房間。
I have reserved a table at the restaurant. 我已在飯店預訂了一桌菜。
3.延遲作出；暫時不作
The court will reserve judgement. 法庭將延期判決。
n.名詞
1.儲備（物）；儲備金；保留（物）；儲藏量[C][U][（+of）]
The old man kept a large reserve of firewood for cold weather. 這位老人貯存了大量的柴薪以備天冷時用。
words.translation:
vt.保存, 預訂
n.保存, 儲存
words.variation:
過去式：reserved 過去分詞：reserved 現在分詞：reserving
名詞複數：reserves

words.description: 同義詞 a.特別的 special, unusual, different
words.example:
adj.形容詞
1.特殊的；特定的；特別的[Z][B]
The teacher showed particular concern for the disabled child. 老師特別關心那個殘疾兒童。
2.特有的，獨特的；異常的[Z][B]
Her particular way of smiling left a good impression on me. 她特有的微笑給我留下了美好的印象。
3.（過於）講究的；苛求的，挑剔的[（+about/over）][（+wh-）]
She is particular about what she eats. 她過分講究吃。
4.細緻的，詳細的[B]
The witness gave us a particular account of what happened. 目擊者把發生的事情詳細地對我們說了一遍。
n.名詞
1.個別的項目，細目[C]
The particular may have to be satisfied to the general. 為顧全總體個別的項目也許不得不放棄。
2.詳細情況[P]
I suppose the secretary knows the particulars of the plan. 我想那位祕書知道這一計畫的詳細情況。
words.translation:
adj.特別的, 細緻的
n.細目

words.description: 同義詞 n.幽默感；幽默 wit, pleasantry, comedy
words.example:
n.名詞
1.幽默[U]
Humor is often more than a laughing matter. 幽默常常不只是一笑了之的事。
He has a good sense of humor. 他富於幽默感。
2.心情，情緒[S]
The boss is in no humor to talk to you right now. 此刻老板沒有心情同你說話。
words.variation:
名詞複數：humors
過去式：humored 過去分詞：humored 現在分詞：humoring
